intro: Rubus lusaticus, commonly known as the Lusatian blackberry, is a species of bramble native to Central Europe. It is characterized by its prickly stems and compound leaves with serrated edges. The plant produces small, dark purple to black berries that are typically harvested in late summer. It thrives in moist, shady environments such as woodlands and stream banks. Botanically, it belongs to the Rosaceae family and is closely related to other raspberries and blackberries.
